New Records: Jaren Jackson Jr. scored a career-high 35 points, 13 rebounds, and five assists.
Memphis Grizzlies finished with 52 points in the paint and 55 total rebounds, including 13 offensive boards.
Key Match Events: Memphis expanded their lead to 13 points in the fourth quarter, their largest of the game.
Dallas relied on three-pointers towards the end but couldn't overcome the deficit.
Pre-Game Insights: Both teams were missing their starting backcourts: Ja Morant and Desmond Bane for the Grizzlies, and Luka Doncic and Kyrie Irving for the Mavericks due to injuries.
Post-Match Reflections: Memphis won for the 10th time in their last 11 home games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Memphis dominated in the paint with 52 points and outrebounded Dallas 55-50.
